definition: the Grand Canal, 1800 km from Beijing to Hangzhou, built starting from 486 BC
abbr. for Beijing/surname Jing/Jing ethnic minority
capital city of a country/big/algebraic term for a large number (old)/artificial mound (old)
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

sentences.english: The Beidaihe inland water transportation is extremely developed, it is interlinked with the Beijing-Hangzhou Canal.
sentences.chinese: 北戴河內河運輸十分發達，與京杭大運河相通。

sentences.english: The Grand Canal of China enters Shandong from the northwest and leaves on the southwest.
sentences.chinese: 京杭大運河自西北向西南流經山東省。

sentences.english: Wuzhen, , an ancient water town in Zhejiang, lies at the riverside of Beijing-Hangzhou Grand Canal.
sentences.chinese: 烏鎮是浙江的一座古老的水鎮，坐落在京杭大運河畔。

sentences.english: Located on the riverside of the Beijing-Hangzhou Grand Canal, Wuzhen of Zhejiang Province is an ancient water town.
sentences.chinese: 烏鎮是浙江的一座古老水鎮，坐落在京杭大運河河畔。

sentences.english: Besides the old Jing-Hang Grand Canal and the Jing-Hu Railway pass through here.
sentences.chinese: 另外，古老的京杭大運河和京滬鐵路也途經這裏。

sentences.english: Botou ancient Beijing-Hangzhou Grand Canal is a major commercial port, business and trade industry is developed.
sentences.chinese: 泊頭自古就是京杭大運河畔一大商埠，商貿業發達。

sentences.english: Renowned at home and abroad of the Beijing-Hangzhou Grand Canal and had to wear Scenic Area.
sentences.chinese: 馳名中外的京杭大運河穿風景區而過。

sentences.english: Inaddition, Jinghang Canal and Jinghu Railroad crosses Wuxi.
sentences.chinese: 另外，古老的京杭大運河和京滬鐵路也途徑這裏。

sentences.english: Since ancient times, there are floods, droughts and the pier, Beijing-Hangzhou Grand Canal longitudinal throughout.
sentences.chinese: 自古有水旱碼頭之稱，京杭大運河縱貫全境。

sentences.english: The city is cut by the Beijing-Hangzhou Grand Canal from north to south.
sentences.chinese: 京杭大運河縱貫蘇州南北，交通十分方便。

definition: the Grand Canal, 1800 km from Beijing to Hangzhou, built starting from 486 BC

scattered about like stars in the sky or chess pieces on a board (idiom); spread all over the place
